revised_title: Comparing Cranial and Facial Characteristics of the Neandertal Race
tldr: The author compares the cranial and facial characteristics of the Neandertal race with those of South Australian aborigines, finding a closer resemblance than previously believed. The study focuses on various measurements and angles, such as calottal height, Schwalbe's angle, and the frontal and orbito-frontal angles, concluding that the Neandertal race has unique features, particularly in the bones of the face and basi-cranial axis.
